title: Bookmarks toolbar missing  - but in just some windows
content: For about a month now I have had an issue with my Bookmarks toolbar disappearing. I have a few different windows that I always keep open and each has a few tabs open or pinned. On just some of those windows, the "bookmarks toolbar" has disappeared (it was there, then it was not). I definitely have "bookmarks toolbar" checked in customizing, so that is not the issue. I found a trick that if I move one or more tabs into a new window (slide to side) that the new window would then have the bookmarks toolbar back. BUT, when I tried that today, I would only have the bookmarks toolbar showing when the window was reduced in size, but if I expanded to full screen, it disappears. How do I get my "bookmarks toolbar" to ALWAYS show in all windows? The only thing that I have changed in my behavior is that I now keep several tabs pinned... wondering if somehow that is causing problems? Please note, I have tried resetting customizing and rechecking "bookmarks toolbar" but that has not resolved the issue. The only extensions or any add-ons that I have are "Adblocker Ultimate" and "Facebook Container". And no themes. I have not "refreshed firefox" because of how much work that would involve to save history, get eveything back to the way I like it, etc., so I am hoping to not have to do that unless you know for sure that would resolve my problem. Thanks.

title: Adrozek Malware recently announced by Microsoft
content:
Microsoft has announced serious security risks to the Firefox browser from the Adrozek Malware (see: https://www.microsoft.com/security/blog/2020/12/10/widespread-malware-campaign-seeks-to-silently-inject-ads-into-search-results-affects-multiple-browsers/?ranMID=24542&ranEAID=J84DHJLQkR4&ranSiteID=J84DHJLQkR4-cw8f44Hxnuw1Qo3dlvtCvw&epi=J84DHJLQkR4-cw8f44Hxnuw1Qo3dlvtCvw&irgwc=1&OCID=AID2000142_aff_7593_1243925&tduid=%28ir__qw0o2fph0gkfq3vpkk0sohzgcn2xsvn2m393x00r00%29%287593%29%281243925%29%28J84DHJLQkR4-cw8f44Hxnuw1Qo3dlvtCvw%29%28%29&irclickid=_qw0o2fph0gkfq3vpkk0sohzgcn2xsvn2m393x00r00).

Is Firefox at risk from an Adrozek Malware attack? Are our passwords that are stored by Firefox safe? What actions do we need to take to protect ourselves from this Malware? Will Mozilla be providing an update to the Firefox browser to address this security risk? Are all platforms at risk (e.g., Windows and Android version of Firefox)?

This sounds very serious. I'm hoping there will be a rapid response to this threat if Firefox is vulnerable.

title: Window position not restored correctly on start (moved by 10px)
content:
Hello,

When closing Firefox, the window's size and position are saved correctly apparently (judging by xulstorage.json's content) but when I start Firefox again the window is shifted to the right by 10px exactly if the window was on the leftmost of the screen (x=0) when closed.

If I close Firefox and the window is on the rightmost of the screen it shift it to the left by 10px exactly too.

If I manually set the window to the whole width of the screen (not with the maximize button), the window is shifted 10px to the right.

If the window is not on the leftmost or rightmost, the position is restored correctly/precisely.

If the window is maximized, it is restored correctly (in its maximized state).

I have checked this behavior with other applications (Chrome, Discord, Microsoft Outlook/Word/Excel) and they all restore their size/position correctly, no shifting.

I have tried deleting xulstorage.json but the issue is still present, and it also happen on a fresh install/profile of Firefox (and Windows).

Question: Is there a way to preserve the position Firefox's window so it is exactly at the leftmost or rightmost of the screen after a restart?

Tested on Firefox version: 83.0, Fresh Install and Profile OS: Windows 10 20H2, Fresh Install, Default Display/Window Settings (Also tested on Windows Server 2016, same behavior).
creator: the.recliner

title: Google Search appears in dark mode even when the browser theme is light.
content: I'm running on Firefox on macOS Big Sur with dark mode on. Google searches appeared with the normal white background color up until today. Now, the searches only appear with the white background color if I leave my operating system with a light theme. I tried using terminal to override the system background color for Firefox to try and get my searches to appear white again, but this didn't work. I also tried using an app which would run the commands itself (in case I had input the wrong commands), but this also didn't work. The odd thing is that even if I turn the Firefox theme to light or any other color, the Google searches still appear in dark mode. Also Firefox is the only browser where the searches appear in dark mode; in both Safari and Chrome the searches still have a white background. Is there any settings I can change in Firefox to fix this or anything else I can do?
creator: doctorstarbies

title: How will the ending of flash support affect existing flash websites?
content:
Dear Mozilla

I noticed today that I.E. was ending support for flash and removing it from Windows entirely. I headed to Firefox and found essentially the same announcement.

I am wondering how Mozilla sees this affecting the existing web and why it is ostensibly being supported? My understanding is that a significant portion of the web makes use of flash and is no longer maintained, meaning that there will be no porting to html5. I know that the internet archives has started developing an alternative to flash in order to maintain the ability to view these websites. Why did Mozilla not go with that approach? Are there any links to discussion pages about this topic where I can read more about the decision?

Thank you Warm regards

title: Firefox closes and reopens constantly without any error messages
content:
Hello! I need help on a very strange problem I had recently with my Firefox. I have Firefox 83.0 64-bit installed on my Windows 7 Home Basic desktop PC. Some time after maybe version 81 and above, I noticed that my Firefox randomly closes and reopens without showing any error messages. I noticed that the most consistent time this phenomenon happens is when I turn on my PC and start Firefox, it almost always closes and reopens, sometimes even more than once. It acts like the browser crashed, but the weird thing is it doesn't show any error message saying that the browser crashed. Once I opened Firefox at least once after I turn on my PC, even if I manually closed it and reopen it later, it will not crash on Firefox startup, it will probably only crash again after I restarted my PC and open Firefox. Also rarely, Firefox randomly closes and reopens whenever I browser whatever website with no reason whatsoever, but this only happens 3 out of 10 times.

I opened Troubleshooting Information to look for clues on what might be causing this, and I noticed "Launcher Process" is "Disabled due to failure". I am not sure what that means though, but I have a feeling this might be related somehow?

If anyone has any idea on what's going on, please help me. Thanks!
